content:
As an AI language model, I don't have real-time labour market information. However, I can tell you that the COVID-19 pandemic has greatly changed the landscape of work in the San Francisco tech sector, just as it has everywhere else in the world.

Remote work has become more prevalent in the tech sector in San Francisco, as well as in other parts of the world. Such a shift has prompted many companies to adopt work-from-home policies, and some have even announced that remote work will continue permanently.

The pandemic has demonstrated that many employees can work effectively from home, and some companies are even seeing increased productivity from remote workers. As a result, remote work has become a popular trend and a point of negotiation for job seekers.

However, this shift towards remote work may have a more significant impact on small tech start-ups who may need to shift their culture, policies, and tools towards remote work. As the pandemic continues, it is casting a long shadow in the workplace, fueling fears of a second wave, and prolonging the uncertainties of how the tech sector will shape up in San Francisco.

In conclusion, remote work is becoming more prevalent in San Francisco's tech sector as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. However, it remains uncertain how long this trend will continue or what long-term effects it will have on the industry.
